title: Varifocal Membrane AR Wins Digital Content Expo of Japan Prize at SIGGRAPH 2017
excerpt: David Dunn, Cary Tippets, Kent Torell, Petr Kellnhofer, Kaan Akşit, Piotr Didyk, Karol Myszkowski, David Luebke, and Henry Fuchs won the Digital Content Expo of Japan Prize at SIGGRAPH 2017 Emerging Technologies for their work on Varifocal displays.

title: i3D 2017: 2nd Place Paper and 3rd Place Presentation
excerpt: At the i3D 2017 Conference in San Francisco, the 2nd place paper and 3rd place presentation was awarded for Scene-Adaptive High Dynamic Range Display for Low Latency Display (Peter Lincoln, Alex Blate, Montek Singh, Andrei State, Mary C. Whitton, Turner Whitted).

title: Best Paper Award at IEEE VR 2017
excerpt: At IEEE VR 2017 in Los Angeles, the best paper was awarded to Wide Field of View Varifocal Near-Eye Display using See-Through Deformable Membrane Mirrors (David Dunn, Cary Tippets, Kent Torell, Petr Kellnhofer, Kaan Aksit, and colleagues).

title: GVR Research Featured in RoadToVR
excerpt: Researchers Demonstrate 100° Dynamic Focus AR Display With Membrane Mirrors — Ben Lang's article on RoadToVR highlights our achievement of a wide field of view in an AR headset.

title: GVR Papers to Appear at IEEE VR and TVCG 2017
excerpt: Several papers accepted to IEEE Virtual Reality 2017 in Los Angeles, including Wide Field of View Varifocal Near-Eye Display using See-Through Deformable Membrane Mirrors.

title: GVR Papers Accepted to I3D 2017
excerpt: Papers accepted to ACM SIGGRAPH Symposium on Interactive 3D Graphics and Games (I3D 2017) in San Francisco, including Scene-Adaptive High Dynamic Range Display for Low Latency Augmented Reality.

title: Long Lasting Impact Paper Awards
excerpt: Awards presented for Spatially augmented reality (IWAR98) by Ramesh Raskar, Greg Welch, and Henry Fuchs, and Dynamic shader lamps: Painting on movable objects (ISAR2001) by Deepak Bandyopadhyay, Ramesh Raskar, and Henry Fuchs.

title: Henry Fuchs Keynote at Eurographics 2016
excerpt: Dr. Henry Fuchs, Federico Gil Distinguished Professor of Computer Science at UNC Chapel Hill, delivered a keynote presentation at Eurographics 2016 in Lisbon, Portugal.

title: Best Paper Award at IEEE VR 2016
excerpt: At IEEE VR 2016 in Greenville, SC, the best paper was awarded to From Motion to Photons in 80 Microseconds: Towards Minimal Latency for Virtual and Augmented Reality (Peter Lincoln, Alex Blate, Montek Singh, Turner Whitted, Andrei State, Henry Fuchs).
